Crisis Support

You are not alone. Help is available right now.

Need Immediate Help?

If you are having thoughts of suicide or self-harm, or are in immediate danger, please contact emergency services right away.

Samaritans Hotline

24-hour emotional support hotline

For immediate danger or emergency situations

Ambulance/Medical Emergency

WhatsApp Crisis Support

If you prefer messaging or can't make a phone call, connect with our crisis support team via WhatsApp.

Crisis Safety Planning

Warning Signs to Watch For:

  • Thoughts of suicide or self-harm
  • Feeling hopeless or trapped
  • Severe mood changes
  • Substance abuse increase
  • Social withdrawal

Immediate Coping Strategies:

  • Call someone you trust
  • Remove harmful objects from reach
  • Practice deep breathing exercises
  • Go to a safe, public place
  • Use grounding techniques (5-4-3-2-1 method)

Important Reminders

  • âœ… You are not alone - crisis support is available 24/7
  • âœ… Your feelings are temporary - this crisis will pass
  • âœ… Seeking help is a sign of strength, not weakness
  • âœ… There are people who care about you and want to help
  • âœ… Professional support can make a real difference

Your safety is our priority. All communications are confidential and secure.
